intro: Restio helenae, commonly known as Helen's restio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to fynbos vegetation. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves with a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers that are clustered in dense spikes. Restio helenae is often found in sandy soils and is well adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region.
